--- title: Log Likelihood tools keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "Support several representations" description: "Support several representations" nb_path: "nbs/10_loglike.ipynb" ---
{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

  • Basic: the Kerr formula
    {% raw %} $$ \displaystyle\log\mathcal{L}(\alpha,\beta\ |\ w,e) = \sum_{w} \log \big( 1 + \alpha\ w + \beta\ (1-w) \big) - e\ (\alpha\ S + \beta\ B) $$ {% endraw %}

  • Poisson: 3-paramter Poisson-like function

{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class LogLike[source]

LogLike(cell)

implement Kerr Eqn 2 for a single interval, or cell

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
n = 100
w = np.full(n, 150, np.uint8)
cell = dict(t=0, tw=1, fexp=1, n=n, w=w, S=100, B=0 )

ll = LogLike(cell)
ll.plot()
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
ll.fit_info()

{'t': 0,
 'tw': 1,
 'fexp': 1,
 'counts': 100,
 'flux': 0.29333318572434913,
 'sig_flux': 0.09999998523910159}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class GaussianRep[source]

GaussianRep(loglike, fix_beta=True)

Manage fits to the loglike object

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class Gaussian2dRep[source]

Gaussian2dRep(loglike) :: GaussianRep

Manage fits to the loglike object

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
gr = GaussianRep(ll)
gr

__main__.GaussianRep: {'t': 0, 'tw': 1, 'fexp': 1, 'counts': 100, 'flux': 0.29333318572434913, 'sig_flux': 0.09999998523910159}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class PoissonRep[source]

PoissonRep(loglike, tol=0.2)

Manage the representation of the log likelihood of a cell by a Poisson Notes: function assumes arg is the rate beta is set to zero (for now)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

The PoissonRep object makes a fit to the Poisson-like representation

{% raw %} 
pr = PoissonRep(ll)
pr

__main__.PoissonRep: flux: 0.293[1+0.330-0.352], limit: 0.47, ts: 10.8
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class PoissonRepTable[source]

PoissonRepTable(loglike) :: PoissonRep

Manage the representation of the log likelihood of a cell by a Poisson Notes: function assumes arg is the rate beta is set to zero (for now)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
prt = PoissonRepTable(ll)
prt

__main__.PoissonRepTable: flux: 0.293[1+0.330-0.352], limit: 0.47, ts: 10.8
{% endraw %}
